style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months ended </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">January&#160;31, 2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;were </font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-decoration:none;">$142,127,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, a </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">4%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">increase</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;compared to net sales of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$136,023,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months ended </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">January&#160;31, 2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. Net sales increased for our Retail and Wholesale Products Group but decreased for our Business to Business Products Group. Segment results are discussed further below.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Consolidated gross profit for the first </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;was </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$38,893,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, or </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">27%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;of net sales, compared to </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$31,414,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, or </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">23%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;of net sales, for the first </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">.&#160;Lower freight and natural gas costs drove the increase in gross profit. Freight costs declined approximately 21% per manufactured ton for the first six months of fiscal year 2020 compared to the same period in fiscal year 2019 as the result of lower transportation rates from improved truck availability. In addition, costs were higher in the first half of the prior fiscal year due to other one-time events, including a greater number of product transfers between our plants and warehouses to support customer service during the implementation of our new ERP system on August 1, 2018 and disruptions due to Hurricane Michael. Our overall freight costs also vary between periods depending on the mix of products sold and the geographic distribution of our customers. The cost of natural gas used to operate kilns that dry our clay was approximately 29% lower per manufactured ton in the first </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;compared to the first </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. Non-fuel manufacturing costs per manufactured ton were flat compared to the first </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months of the prior fiscal year. In contrast, packaging costs per manufactured ton for the first </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;were slightly higher compared to the first </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, due in part to the mix of products produced. In addition, many of our contracts for packaging purchases are subject to periodic price adjustments, which trail changes in underlying commodity prices.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Total SG&amp;A expenses were </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$28,899,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;for the first </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, a </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">5%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">increase</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;compared to </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$27,584,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;for the first </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">.&#160;The discussion of the segments' operating incomes below describes the changes in SG&amp;A expenses that were allocated to the operating segments.&#160;The remaining unallocated corporate expenses included a higher estimated annual incentive bonus accrual, which was based on performance targets established for each fiscal year. The increased bonus expense was p</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#222222;">artially offset by a curtailment gain reported upon the freeze of our SERP in the second quarter of fiscal year 2020 (see Note </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#222222;">7</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#222222;">&#32;of the Notes to the unaudited Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements). In addition, higher SG&amp;A expenses were reported in the first half of fiscal year 2019 for consulting costs related to our </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">ERP system implemented in the first quarter of the prior fiscal year and legal costs for legal proceedings resolved in the third quarter of the prior fiscal year.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div><br></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;23</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Consolidated net income before taxes for the first </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;was </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$9,835,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, a </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">168%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">increase</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;from net income before taxes of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$3,672,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;for the first </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. Results for the first </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;were driven by the factors discussed above, including higher sales and lower freight and natural gas costs, which more than offset the increase in SG&amp;A expenses.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The tax expense for the first </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;was </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$1,626,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;(an effective tax rate of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">16.5%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">) compared to </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$456,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;for the first </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;(an effective tax rate of 12.4%). An estimated annual effective tax rate was used in both periods to determine the provision for income taxes, which is based on expected annual taxable income and the assessment of various tax deductions, including depletion. The lower tax rate in fiscal year 2019 primarily relates to the discrete benefit recorded relating to the completion of a federal income tax return examination in the first quarter of that year. </font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">BUSINESS TO BUSINESS PRODUCTS GROUP</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Net sales of the Business to Business Products Group for the first </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;were </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$50,949,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">a decrease</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$835,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, or </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, from net sales of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$51,784,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;for the first </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. Net sales of our agricultural and horticultural chemical carrier products </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">decreased</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;approximately </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">19%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;for the first six months of fiscal year 2020 compared to the same period in fiscal year 2019. Sales of traditional granules declined due primarily to the loss of a customer, which was partially offset by increased sales to an existing customer. These lower sales were significantly offset by higher sales of other products in the Business to Business Group, including an increase of approximately </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">11%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;compared to the first six months of the prior fiscal year for sales of our co-packaged coarse cat litter. Net sales of our animal health and nutrition products also </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">increased</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;approximately </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">8%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;compared to the first </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months of the prior year. Sales growth occurred for our feed additives primarily in Africa, Mexico and Asia, excluding China. See &#8220;Foreign Operations&#8221; below for a discussion of sales in China, which were impacted by the spread of the African swine fever in the prior year and the recent novel coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak (&#8220;the coronavirus&#8221;). Net sales of our fluids purification products increased approximately </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">1%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;compared to the first six months of the prior fiscal year as higher sales to edible oil producers offset lower sales that resulted from a biodiesel processing customer closing operations.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">SG&amp;A expenses for the Business to Business Products Group were approximately 7% higher for the first </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;compared to the same period of the prior year, including higher costs for product development and support, increased compensation-related expenses and additional costs to establish our subsidiary in Indonesia.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The Business to Business Products Group&#8217;s operating income for the first </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;was </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$15,848,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">an increase</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$1,544,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, or </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">11%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, from operating income of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$14,304,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;for the first </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">.&#160;The improved operating income was driven primarily by the lower freight and natural gas costs discussed in &#8220;Consolidated Results&#8221; above.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">RETAIL AND WHOLESALE PRODUCTS GROUP</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Net sales of the Retail and Wholesale Products Group for the first </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;were </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$91,178,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">an increase</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$6,939,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, or </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">8%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, from net sales of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$84,239,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;for the first </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. Sales of cat litter drove the sales increase. Total cat litter net sales were approximately </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">11%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">higher</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;compared to the first </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months of the prior fiscal year, with increased sales for both private label and branded litters. Sales of private label scoopable litter increased to existing customers, some of whom had expanded their selection of our products during the prior fiscal year. Higher sales of private label coarse litter included incremental sales to customers who added these products in the second half of the prior fiscal year. Branded coarse litter and litter box liners sales were also higher compared to the first half of the prior fiscal year. Cat litter sales by our subsidiary in Canada further contributed to the sales increase, as discussed in &#8220;Foreign Operations&#8221; below. Also included in the Retail and Wholesale Products Group's results were slightly lower sales for our industrial and automotive products compared to the first </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">SG&amp;A expenses for the Retail and Wholesale Products Group were approximately 7% lower in the first </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;compared to the first </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. Lower advertising expense in the first </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months of fiscal year 2020 contributed to the reduction in costs compared to the same period in the prior year; however, we expect spending for advertising in the remainder of fiscal 2020 to result in a higher expense for the full year of fiscal 2020 compared to fiscal year 2019. In addition, non-recurring expenses were incurred in the first half of fiscal year 2019 for customer compliance fees related to shipping and data communication incurred in connection with the implementation of the ERP system.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The Retail and Wholesale Products Group's operating income for the first </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;was </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$8,968,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">an increase</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$6,306,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;from operating income of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$2,662,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;for the first </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. The improved operating income was driven by the higher sales and lower SG&amp;A described above, and by lower freight and natural gas costs discussed in &#8220;Consolidated Results&#8221;.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div><br></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;24</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">FOREIGN OPERATIONS</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Foreign operations include our subsidiaries in Canada and the United Kingdom, which are reported in the Retail and Wholesale Products Group, and our subsidiaries in China, Mexico and Indonesia, which are reported in the Business to Business Products Group. Net sales by our foreign subsidiaries during the first </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;were </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$7,154,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, an </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">increase</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$672,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, or </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">10%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, compared to net sales of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$6,482,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;during the first </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. This increase was attributable primarily to new cat litter business for our Canada subsidiary. Sales of our animal health products by our foreign operations grew to a lesser extent, as higher sales for our subsidiaries in Mexico and Indonesia were mostly offset by lower sales for our subsidiary in China. Sales of animal health products to pork producers in China have not fully recovered since the spread of African swine fever in fiscal year 2019. In addition, our Chinese subsidiary's business operations have been impacted in the second quarter of fiscal year 2020 by the recent outbreak of the coronavirus. Chinese government restrictions to control the spread of the coronavirus disrupted our sales office, limited travel by our salesforce and delayed product shipments. Net sales by our foreign subsidiaries represented </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">5%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;of our consolidated net sales during the first </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months of both fiscal years </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Our foreign subsidiaries reported </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">a net loss</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$169,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;for the first </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, compared to </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">net income</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$315,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;for the first </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. The lower sales described above for our subsidiary in China and additional costs to establish operations in Indonesia drove the net loss.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Identifiable assets of our foreign subsidiaries as of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;were </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$10,158,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, compared to </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$9,643,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;as of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">January&#160;31, 2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">.&#160;The </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">increase</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;was attributed primarily to the addition of our subsidiary in Indonesia and new right-of-use lease assets recorded upon the implementation of ASC 842, </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Leases</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div><a name="sC6C10D456011B9E1F5017C814F43CB8E"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:underline;">THREE MONTHS ENDED </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:underline;">JANUARY&#160;31, 2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:underline;">&#32;COMPARED TO</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:underline;">THREE MONTHS ENDED </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:underline;">JANUARY&#160;31, 2019</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">CONSOLIDATED RESULTS</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Consolidated net sales for the three months ended </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">January&#160;31, 2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;were </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">$71,005,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, a 2% increase compared to net sales of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">$69,880,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;for the three months ended </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">January&#160;31, 2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. Net sales increased for our Retail and Wholesale Products Group, but decreased for our Business to Business Products Group. Segment results are discussed further below.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Consolidated gross profit for the three months ended </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;was </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$18,958,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, or </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">27%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;of net sales, compared to </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$15,404,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, or </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">22%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;of net sales, for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">.&#160;Lower freight and natural gas costs drove the increase in gross profit. Freight costs declined approximately 21% for the second quarter of fiscal year 2020 per manufactured ton as the result of lower transportation rates from improved truck availability. Our overall freight costs also vary between periods depending on the mix of products sold and the geographic distribution of our customers. The cost of natural gas used to operate kilns that dry our clay was approximately 36% lower per manufactured ton for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;compared to the same period of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. Non-fuel manufacturing costs per ton produced were slightly lower compared to the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter in the prior fiscal year. In contrast, packaging costs per manufactured ton were slightly higher compared to the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of the prior fiscal year, driven primarily by the mix of products produced. In addition, many of our contracts for packaging purchases are subject to periodic price adjustments, which trail changes in underlying commodity prices.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Total SG&amp;A expenses were </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$13,085,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, a </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">4%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">increase</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;compared to </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$12,577,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">.&#160;The discussion below describes the SG&amp;A expenses allocated to the operating segments. The remaining unallocated corporate expenses included a higher estimated annual incentive bonus accrual, which was based on performance targets established for each fiscal year. The increased bonus expense was p</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#222222;">artially offset by a curtailment gain reported upon the freeze of our SERP in the second quarter of fiscal year 2020 (see Note </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#222222;">7</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#222222;">&#32;of the Notes to the unaudited Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements). In addition, lower SG&amp;A expenses were reported in the second quarter of fiscal year 2020 for consulting costs related to our </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">ERP system and costs for legal proceedings resolved in the third quarter of the prior fiscal year.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Consolidated net income before taxes for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;was </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$5,758,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, compared to net income before taxes of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$2,788,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. Results for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;were driven by the factors described above, including higher sales and lower freight and natural gas costs, which more than offset the increase in SG&amp;A expenses.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Tax expense was </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$1,009,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, compared to </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$506,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, which resulted in an effective tax rate of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">18%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarters of both fiscal years. We used an estimated annual </font></div><div><br></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;25</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">effective tax rate in determining our quarterly provision for income taxes, which is based on expected annual taxable income and the assessment of various tax deductions, including depletion.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">BUSINESS TO BUSINESS PRODUCTS GROUP</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Net sales of the Business to Business Products Group for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;were </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$24,471,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">a decrease</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$1,987,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, or </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">8%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, from net sales of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$26,458,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. Net sales of our agricultural and horticultural chemical carrier products </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">decreased</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">31%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, due primarily to the loss of a customer for our traditional granules. Net sales of our fluids purification products </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">decreased</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;approximately </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">1%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;for the second quarter of fiscal year 2020. Lower sales due to a plant closing of a biodiesel processing customer was partially offset by higher sales to edible oil producers. Net sales of our animal health and nutrition products were essentially flat as sales growth for our feed additives in Mexico and Asia, excluding China, mostly offset lower sales in China. See &#8220;Foreign Operations&#8221; below for a discussion of sales in China, which were impacted by the spread of the African swine fever in the prior year and the recent outbreak of the coronavirus. Net sales of our co-packaged coarse cat litter for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter were approximately </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">8%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;higher compared to the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of the prior year.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">SG&amp;A expenses for the Business to Business Products Group were approximately 11% higher compared to the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, including higher costs for product development and support and compensation-related expenses.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The Business to Business Products Group&#8217;s operating income for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;was </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$7,552,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">an increase</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$280,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, or </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">4%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, from operating income of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$7,272,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. The improved operating income was driven by the lower freight and natural gas costs discussed in &#8220;Consolidated Results&#8221; above.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">RETAIL AND WHOLESALE PRODUCTS GROUP</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Net sales of the Retail and Wholesale Products Group for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;were </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$46,534,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">an increase</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$3,112,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, or </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">7%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, from net sales of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$43,422,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. Total cat litter net sales were </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">10%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">higher</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;compared to the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, driven by increased sales of both private label and branded litters. Sales of private label scoopable litter increased to existing customers, some of whom had expanded their selection of our products during the prior fiscal year. Higher sales of private label coarse litter included incremental sales to customers who added these products in the second half of the prior fiscal year. Branded coarse litter and litter box liners sales were also higher compared to the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of the prior year. Cat litter sales by our subsidiary in Canada also contributed to the sales increase, as discussed in &#8220;Foreign Operations&#8221; below. Also included in the Retail and Wholesale Products Group's results were slightly lower sales for our industrial and automotive products compared to the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">SG&amp;A expenses for the Retail and Wholesale Products Group were slightly higher to support the increased sales compared to the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">For the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the Retail and Wholesale Products Group reported operating </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">income</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$5,608,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">an increase</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$2,955,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, compared to operating income of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$2,653,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. The improved operating income was driven by the higher sales described above, and by lower freight and natural gas costs discussed above in &#8220;Consolidated Results&#8221;.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">FOREIGN OPERATIONS</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Foreign operations included our subsidiaries in Canada and the United Kingdom, which are reported in the Retail and Wholesale Products Group, and our subsidiaries in China, Mexico and Indonesia, which are reported in the Business to Business Products Group. Net sales by our foreign subsidiaries during the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;were </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">$3,505,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, a </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">15%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">increase</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;compared to net sales of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">$3,039,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. This increase was attributable primarily to new cat litter business and improved sales of industrial absorbents for our Canada subsidiary. Sales of our animal health products by our foreign operations grew to a lesser extent, as higher sales for our Mexico and Indonesia subsidiaries were mostly offset by lower sales for our subsidiary in China. Sales of these products to pork producers in China have not fully recovered since the spread of African swine fever in fiscal year 2019. In addition, business operations of our Chinese subsidiary have been impacted in the second quarter of fiscal year 2020 by the recent outbreak of the coronavirus. Chinese government restrictions to control the spread of the coronavirus disrupted our sales office, limited travel by our salesforce and delayed product shipments. Our foreign subsidiaries' net sales represented approximately </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">5%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">4%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;of consolidated net sales during the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarters of fiscal years </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, respectively.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Our foreign subsidiaries reported </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">a net loss</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;attributable to Oil-Dri of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$101,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;compared to </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">net income</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$79,000</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. The lower sales described above for our China subsidiary, </font></div><div><br></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;26</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">higher material costs for our subsidiary in the United Kingdom and additional costs to establish operations in Indonesia drove the net loss.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div><a name="sCEF95BADE7999612BE4B7C814F7C564D"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:underline;">LIQUIDITY AND CAPITAL RESOURCES</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Our principal capital requirements include: funding working capital needs; purchasing and upgrading equipment, facilities, information systems and real estate; supporting new product development; investing in infrastructure; repurchasing stock; paying dividends; making pension contributions; and, from time to time, business acquisitions.&#160;During the first </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">six</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2020</font><font
